mods.abstract: Inaugural Gay Time radio show, April 17, 1948, part 6. Featuring host Connie B. Gay and producer Bob Keefe; with performers Chubby Wise, the Radio Ranchmen led by Clyde Moody, Pete Cassell, the Wheeler Brothers (Joe and Buddy), Vic Johnson (name unconfirmed), the Darnell Sisters, Frank Robinson, the Free State Ramblers, the Blue Melody Boys (Harold Dent and Harold Byram), Grandpa Jones, Bob Dean and the Southern Serenaders with 'Hink', Tex Cherry, the Ralph Case Square Dancers, the Georgia Boys including 'Smitty' and 'Smiley' (names unconfirmed), tap dance group Bill Towne and his Memphis Belle Boys (names unconfirmed), Pete Foster, Slim Stuart (name unconfirmed), and T. Texas Tyler; as well as a message from Millard West, the vice-president of the American Cancer campaign of Washington, D.C. Broadcast by WWDC-FM; held at Constitution Hall, Washington, D.C. It is announced that Hank Penny and Hawkshaw Hawkins will appear on the following week's show.

subject.topic: Blue Melody Boys (Musical group : Dent, Byram)
